intro: Haplopappus traskae, commonly known as Trask's goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Haplopappus traskae is adapted to arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
